description: NVIDIA Xid error code reference. Used by Linux Xid error collector and analyzer.

8.detail: The GPU stopped processing requests. May indicate driver bug or hardware issue.

13.detail: The GPU graphics engine experienced a fault. Commonly caused by overclocking, overheating, or driver bugs.

31.detail: Invalid GPU memory access. May indicate faulty VRAM, driver bug, or application error.

32.detail: The GPU command buffer was corrupted. Often indicates driver or application bug.

38.detail: GPU firmware version does not match the driver expectation.

43.detail: The GPU stopped responding to the driver. Severe — may require reboot.

45.detail: Driver performed preemptive cleanup due to previous errors.

48.detail: Uncorrectable memory error detected. Indicates failing VRAM — hardware replacement may be needed.

56.detail: Error in the display engine pipeline. May cause display glitches or blackouts.

57.detail: Hardware video encoder or decoder encountered an error.

61.detail: An internal GPU microcontroller reported an error.

62.detail: An internal GPU microcontroller hit a breakpoint/exception.

63.detail: GPU memory row remapping exhausted. VRAM is degrading — hardware replacement recommended.

64.detail: Failed to record row remapping entry.

68.detail: The GPU video processor encountered an exception.

69.detail: The GPU graphics engine raised an exception. Often related to overclocking or failing hardware.

79.summary: GPU has fallen off the bus
79.detail: The GPU is no longer accessible via PCIe. Critical hardware issue — check PCIe slot, power connections, and GPU seating. May indicate failing GPU or PSU.

92.detail: Elevated rate of correctable ECC errors. VRAM may be degrading.

94.detail: ECC error was contained and corrected, but frequency should be monitored.

95.detail: Uncontained ECC error — data corruption possible. Monitor closely.

119.detail: GPU System Processor firmware encountered an error. Often requires driver reinstall or GPU reset.
